title: Data Scraping — Dataset Fails Coverage & Format Requirements
description: A buyer hired a seller to scrape and deliver a U.S. real estate agent dataset with strict coverage, deduplication, and format requirements. The seller claims the work was delivered on time and that the buyer’s later complaints are about “nice-to-have” enrichments and normal scrape variability, so the final payment should be released. The buyer argues the delivered CSV misses key required fields, fails the minimum coverage threshold, and contains excessive duplicates, making it non-compliant under the contract’s acceptance criteria.

evidenceSpecs.name: LOBSTR_Scrape_Agreement_Harper_Jiao_2026-02.pdf
evidenceSpecs.description: Service agreement defining the scraping scope, deliverables, acceptance criteria, payment schedule, and cure/acceptance process.
evidenceSpecs.content: [{"heading":"PARTIES","body":"This Data Scraping Services Agreement (the \"Agreement\") is entered into on 2026-02-03 between (1) Evelyn Harper (\"Buyer\"), operating as Harper Growth Studio, and (2) Ming Jiao (\"Seller\"), an independent data contractor. The services are procured and paid in LOB tokens via the LOBSTR marketplace on Base (Ethereum L2)."},{"heading":"SCOPE OF WORK","body":"Seller will produce a dataset of U.S.-based residential real estate agents sourced from public brokerage/agent profile pages and reputable directories (no paywalled sources). Deliverables: (A) Primary dataset in CSV format named \"us_real_estate_agents.csv\"; (B) Data dictionary in PDF named \"data_dictionary.pdf\" describing each column and allowed values; (C) Source list in CSV named \"source_domains.csv\" with the domains scraped and record counts per domain. Required fields per record: full_name, brokerage_name, city, state, phone (E.164 preferred), email (if publicly listed), profile_url, source_domain, license_id (if publicly listed), last_seen_date (YYYY-MM-DD). The dataset must be limited to the United States and residential agents; exclude commercial-only agents when identifiable."},{"heading":"COMPENSATION","body":"Total fee: 12,000 LOB. Payment schedule: 4,000 LOB escrowed/released upon project start (non-refundable once work begins); 5,000 LOB released upon delivery of all deliverables; 3,000 LOB released upon Acceptance (as defined below). Any on-chain transfer fees are borne by the paying party. No additional fees are due unless a written change order is agreed in the LOBSTR order chat."},{"heading":"TIMELINE","body":"Project start date: 2026-02-03. Interim sample: Seller will deliver a 200-row sample CSV by 2026-02-07 for format confirmation. Final delivery of all deliverables due by 2026-02-14 23:59 UTC via LOBSTR order file upload or a mutually agreed link. Buyer review window: 3 calendar days after final delivery (through 2026-02-17 23:59 UTC)."},{"heading":"ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA & DELIVERY REQUIREMENTS","body":"Acceptance is conditioned on meeting all of the following measurable criteria: (1) Record count: at least 10,000 unique agent records. (2) Coverage: at least 85% of records must contain non-empty values for each of the following: full_name, city, state, profile_url, source_domain. (3) Contactability: at least 60% of records must contain a phone number OR email (either is sufficient) sourced from the public profile page (no guessing). (4) Deduplication: duplicate rate must be <= 3% as measured by exact match on profile_url OR by (full_name + brokerage_name + city + state) normalized; duplicates beyond 3% constitute nonconforming delivery. (5) Format: CSV must be UTF-8, comma-delimited, with one header row; dates must be YYYY-MM-DD; state must be 2-letter USPS abbreviations. Buyer will provide written notice of nonconformity within the review window with at least 3 specific examples; Seller has a single cure period of 5 calendar days to remedy and resubmit. If Seller fails to cure within the cure period, Buyer may reject and the 3,000 LOB Acceptance payment will not be released."},{"heading":"ADDITIONAL TERMS (QUALITY, SUBCONTRACTING, & DISPUTES)","body":"Quality Standard: Seller warrants that data is collected from public webpages without bypassing access controls and will not fabricate emails/phones. Subcontracting: Seller may not subcontract scraping or data enrichment without Buyer’s written consent in the LOBSTR order chat; breach is grounds for rejection. Late Delivery: If final delivery occurs after 2026-02-14 23:59 UTC, Buyer may impose a 5% reduction of the remaining unpaid amount per 24 hours late, capped at 20%, unless Buyer agreed in writing to an extension. Disputes: In the event of dispute, the Contract and the LOBSTR order records will control."}]

evidenceSpecs.name: LOBSTR_Chat_Screenshot_Feb2026.png
evidenceSpecs.description: A realistic screenshot-style depiction of the LOBSTR order chat showing delivery and the buyer’s nonconformity notice within the review window, plus the seller’s reply disputing the requirements.
evidenceSpecs.content: DALL-E prompt: realistic screenshot, high detail, sharp text, modern UI design. A desktop marketplace web app chat interface titled “LOBSTR Order #78421 — Data Scraping”. Dark header bar with a Base network indicator dot, left sidebar showing order details (buyer name Evelyn Harper, seller name Ming Jiao, order status). Main panel shows a chronological chat with message bubbles and file upload cards. Include a file card for a CSV upload with a timestamp around mid-February 2026 and two other file cards (PDF and CSV). Show a later message from the buyer with an attached small thumbnail of a spreadsheet preview (columns visible but text not legible) and a highlighted section indicating missing values and duplicates. Show the seller responding with a message bubble that references “delivered 10k+ rows” and “scrapes vary; email optional”, and the buyer referencing “Acceptance criteria: 85% coverage and <=3% duplicates” with a visible quote-style block. Include subtle UI elements: message timestamps, a ‘Review window ends’ banner, and an escrow/payment widget on the right showing three milestones with the last milestone pending. Do not include any legible brand logos; keep it generic but clearly a modern web chat UI.

evidenceSpecs.name: LOBSTR_Order78421_Records.csv
evidenceSpecs.description: Order ledger and delivery/review timeline records including milestone payments, delivery timestamps, and the buyer’s rejection notice.

mcQuestions.question: Under the contract’s Acceptance Criteria, what is the maximum allowed duplicate rate before the delivery is nonconforming?
options: Any duplicates are allowed if record count is >= 10,000

mcQuestions.question: What was the final delivery deadline (date and time standard) stated in the agreement’s Timeline section?
Cross-referencing the contract and the order records, did the buyer send a nonconformity notice within the stated review window?
options: Yes; final delivery was 2026-02-14 and notice was 2026-02-16, which is within 3 calendar days
No; notice was required within 24 hours and was sent two days late
No; notice was sent after 2026-02-17 23:59 UTC
Yes; but only because the seller proposed a cure on 2026-02-17

mcQuestions.question: Which deliverable set is explicitly required in the Scope of Work (not merely implied)?
options: A primary CSV dataset, a data dictionary PDF, and a source_domains CSV
A SQLite database file and a Jupyter notebook explaining the scrape
A Google Sheet with edit access and a Loom walkthrough video
A REST API endpoint that serves the scraped records

mcQuestions.question: Cross-referencing the records CSV and the contract cure clause, when did the seller resubmit the cure attempt, and was a single cure period contemplated?
options: Resubmitted on 2026-02-21; the contract allows a single cure period of 5 calendar days after notice
Resubmitted on 2026-02-17; the contract allows unlimited cure attempts until acceptance
Resubmitted on 2026-02-22; the contract requires cure within 10 business days
Resubmitted on 2026-02-14; the contract provides no cure mechanism

analysisPrompt: Evaluate whether the seller’s final delivery and cure resubmission satisfied the measurable Acceptance Criteria in LOBSTR_Scrape_Agreement_Harper_Jiao_2026-02.pdf, and whether the buyer followed the notice/review process. Use LOBSTR_Order78421_Records.csv to confirm delivery, notice, and cure timing, and consider the chat context depicted in LOBSTR_Chat_Screenshot_Feb2026.png for each party’s stated position on the requirements.
gradingRubric:
- Identify the controlling Acceptance Criteria thresholds (10,000 unique records; 85% coverage for full_name/city/state/profile_url/source_domain; 60% contactability; <=3% duplicates; format rules) from the Acceptance Criteria section of LOBSTR_Scrape_Agreement_Harper_Jiao_2026-02.pdf.
- Confirm from LOBSTR_Order78421_Records.csv that final delivery occurred on 2026-02-14 and the buyer’s NonconformityNotice was sent on 2026-02-16, within the 3-day review window ending 2026-02-17 23:59 UTC (Timeline section).
- Apply the cure clause: a single 5-calendar-day cure period after notice; verify cure resubmission timing on 2026-02-21 in LOBSTR_Order78421_Records.csv and assess whether failure to cure permits rejection and non-release of the 3,000 LOB Acceptance milestone.
- Distinguish required vs optional data elements: phone/email are not individually mandatory, but the contract requires 60% of records to contain a phone OR email, and prohibits fabrication (Additional Terms + Acceptance Criteria).
- Note that the seller’s argument that “email is optional” is incomplete because contactability is a quantified acceptance metric (Acceptance Criteria) and not waived by the Scope section.
- Confirm the payment structure and what is actually disputed: 4,000 LOB already released at start and 3,000 LOB Acceptance milestone withheld; reference Compensation section and the denied milestone event in LOBSTR_Order78421_Records.csv.
- Use the LOBSTR_Chat_Screenshot_Feb2026.png depiction to corroborate that the buyer cited duplicates/coverage/contactability issues and that the seller disputed the interpretation, but prioritize the written contract metrics as controlling (Disputes clause).
